question.title: What is the term for the appearance of a bursa that glows under a blue light?
question.description: A bursa that appears to glow under a blue light when viewed under a transilluminator.

option_a.title: Transilluminable
option_a.description: A type of bursa that appears to glow under a blue light when viewed under a transilluminator.

option_b.title: Non-transilluminable
option_b.description: A type of bursa that does not appear to glow under a blue light when viewed under a transilluminator.

option_c.title: Transilluminable cyst
option_c.description: A type of cyst that appears to glow under a blue light when viewed under a transilluminator.

option_d.title: Glowing bursitis
option_d.description: Inflammation of the bursa that causes it to appear to glow under a blue light when viewed under a transilluminator.

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct answer, indicating the first letter of the correct option.
